basics.name: Inyoung Cheong
basics.Topics: Free speech, Privacy, Generative AI, Large language models, Content Moderation, Platform Governance

education.institution: University of Washington, Seattle, WA, United States
Seoul National University, Seoul, South Korea
courses: Alternative Dispute Resolution and the Right to Fair Trial
Justice Sentiment and Aesthetic Judgment: Moral Theories of Immanuel Kant and David Hume

work.name: University of Washington School of Law
work.summary: Taught "Technology Law and Public Policy Seminar" to 25 J.D. and LL.M. students with a specific focus on algorithms as speech, different notions of privacy, and content moderation.

work.name: University of Washington School of Computer Science & Engineering
work.summary: Advised by Tadayoshi Kohno, have explored collaborative governance models that leverage the expertise and incentives of various stakeholders to promote trust and safety through legal and qualitative methods.

work.name: Administrative Conference of the United States
work.summary: Performed comprehensive research on complex case law and statutes, and global regulations on the removal of agency heads and legal implications of automated decisions within the U.S. federal government.

work.name: United Nations Office of Under Secretary-General
work.summary: Formulated and cultivated sustainable development goals-conscious strategic regional partnerships, called "UN75 Cities," with South Korean local governments, while directly reporting to the Under-Secretary-General.

work.name: Ministry of Culture, Sports, and Tourism
work.summary: Established a strategic plan, "Future Technology for Culture & Arts," by gathering the opinions of businesses, researchers, academics, and civil society, leading to a record-setting budget increase ($100 million a year).

work.name: Korea Communications Commission
work.summary: Interpreted relevant laws, implemented user experiments and coordinated conflicting political views to ensure the successful grant of a license to operate to a public broadcasting channel. Led an investigation into a deceptive advertising scandal involving the leading national newspaper. Upon uncovering evidence of violations, took decisive action by imposing injunctions and fines on the newspaper. Executed art funds for Webtoon and Fashion design. Supported Webtoon (digital comics) artists to formulate the industry's self-regulatory body in a collaboration with major Webtoon platforms.

awards.title: Global Business Law Institute Fellowship
awards.awarder: University of Washington School of Law
